definition: Jeet Kun Do or Way of the Intercepting Fist, a fusion of Eastern and Western martial arts led by Bruce Lee 李小龍|李小龙[Li3 Xiao3 long2]
to cut off (a length)/to stop/to intercept/section/chunk/length

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: Very few Jun Fan Jeet Kune Do instructors actually know how to use the mook jong!
sentences.chinese: 很少有振藩截拳道練習者知道如何去使用木人樁。

sentences.english: When I first started learning Jeet Kune Do, I was incredibly excited.
sentences.chinese: 當我開始學習截拳道時，我是極其地興奮。

sentences.english: Nowadays, of JKD do fans have around the world.
sentences.chinese: 如今，截拳道愛好者們已經遍佈世界各地。

sentences.english: To correctly size things up, footwork is truly everything in Jeet Kune Do.
sentences.chinese: 正確的大小事情，步法是真正的一切，截拳道。

sentences.english: Now there are three stages in the cultivation of Jeet Kune Do, each of them interrelated.
sentences.chinese: 截拳道的發展有三個階段，彼此密切關聯。

sentences.english: I have not until now personally written an article on JKD.
sentences.chinese: 在此之前，我從未寫過關於截拳道的文章。

sentences.english: Jeet Kune Do is the outcome of his ideas, thought, and fighting experiences.
sentences.chinese: 截拳道是結果他的理念，思想，和戰鬥力的經驗。

definition: military skill or technique (in former times)/all kinds of martial art sports (some claiming spiritual development)/self-defense/tradition of choreographed fights from opera and film (recent usage)/also called kungfu 功夫/CL:種|种[zhong3]
Ba Ji Quan "Eight Extremes Fist" - Martial Art
Bruce Lee (1940-1973), Hong Kong actor and martial arts expert
Wing Chun/same as 詠春拳|咏春拳[yong3 chun1 quan2]/Yongchun - "Singing Spring Fist" (Chinese martial art)
